articles.headline: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
articles.description: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

images.name: Chris Henry Jr. [608x342]
images.caption: Chris Henry Jr. committed to Ohio State in July of 2023.

images.name: Keenyi Pepe [800x800]
images.caption: Keenyi Pepe adds another impressive building block to USC's OL class.

articles.byline: Craig Haubert, Eli Lederman and Tom Luginbill

articles.headline: Jaden O'Neal gives Florida State highest-rated QB since 2022 class
articles.description: Four-star quarterback Jaden O'Neal, ranked No. 112 in the 2026 ESPN 300, announced his commitment to Florida State on Sunday night, sealing a long-anticipated flip for the former Oklahoma pledge.

articles.headline: Defensive end Richard Wesley commits to Texas Longhorns
articles.description: Defensive end Richard Wesley, a 6-foot-5, 250-pound pass rusher from Chatsworth, California, has committed to Texas, the No. 18 overall prospect in the 2026 ESPN 300 announced on Sunday night following an official visit with the Longhorns this weekend.

articles.headline: Ex-Buckeye Kirk Barton facing charge after fatal crash in Ohio
articles.description: Kirk Barton, a former captain at Ohio State who went on to play in the NFL, faces an aggravated vehicular manslaughter charge following a fatal crash early Saturday morning.

articles.headline: Notre Dame lands commitments from Khary Adams, Joey O'Brien
articles.description: Notre Dame landed pledges from a pair of top 2026 defensive back targets Friday, edging a trio of recruiting rivals to the commitments of No. 8 cornerback Khary Adams and No. 4 athlete prospect Joey O'Brien.

articles.headline: Oklahoma fills need with commitment of 4-star QB Bowe Bentley
articles.description: Four-star quarterback Bowe Bentley, No. 261 in the 2026 ESPN 300, announced his commitment to Oklahoma over LSU on Friday.

article.headline: Walker, Kargman lead Kent State past Akron 33-27
article.description: — Devontez Walker scored three touchdowns, first-time starter Devin Kargman threw two TD passes, and Kent State defeated Akron 33-27 on Saturday, giving the Golden Flashes the Wagon Wheel for the fourth consecutive time.
article.linkText: Walker, Kargman lead Kent State past Akron 33-27

images.name: Devin Kargman throws 35-yard TD pass to Devontez Walker
images.caption: Devin Kargman throws 35-yard TD pass to Devontez Walker

video.headline: Devin Kargman throws 35-yard TD pass to Devontez Walker
video.caption: Devin Kargman throws 35-yard TD pass to Devontez Walker
video.title: Devin Kargman throws 35-yard TD pass to Devontez Walker
video.description: Devin Kargman throws 35-yard TD pass to Devontez Walker

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Devin Kargman throws 35-yard TD pass to Devontez Walker) 2022/10/22 ESHEET

article.story: KENT, Ohio -- — Devontez Walker scored three touchdowns, first-time starter Devin Kargman threw two TD passes, and Kent State defeated Akron 33-27 on Saturday, giving the Golden Flashes the Wagon Wheel for the fourth consecutive time. Kargman completed 14 of 25 passes for 215 yards with both of his touchdowns going to Walker, who also scored on a 14-yard reverse. Kargman, a freshman who had attempted eight passes this season, started in place of Collin Schlee, who did not suit up for the game because of an undisclosed injury. The Golden Flashes' Andrew Glass kicked a 42-yard field goal for a 33-24 lead early in the fourth quarter. Kent State held the nine-point advantage until 39 seconds remained when Akron settled for a Cory Smigel 42-yard field goal. The Zips had reached the 5-yard line on the drive, but DJ Irons was sacked by JoJo Evans and Khali Saunders on third-and-goal. Marquez Cooper led Kent State (3-5, 2-2 Mid-American Conference) with 137 yards rushing on 28 carries. Walker had five receptions for 72 yards, including touchdowns of 35 yards and 10 yards. Bryan Bradford had a 58-yard touchdown run. Irons completed 32 of 43 passes for 383 yards with a touchdown and two interceptions. He threw an 80-yard TD pass to Alex Adams, who caught nine passes for 199 yards for the Zips (1-7, 0-4). ------
